net.sitecore.android.sdk.widget
Class ItemsBrowserFragment

java.lang.Object
  android.app.Fragment
      android.app.DialogFragment
          net.sitecore.android.sdk.widget.ItemsBrowserFragment
All Implemented Interfaces:
android.content.ComponentCallbacks, android.content.ComponentCallbacks2, android.content.DialogInterface.OnCancelListener, android.content.DialogInterface.OnDismissListener, android.view.View.OnCreateContextMenuListener
public class ItemsBrowserFragment
extends android.app.DialogFragment

A fragment that allows to browse through Sitecore content tree. It manages all network events and caches successful responses using ScItemsProvider content provider. Under the hood items are loaded using ScApiSession and cached in database using ScItemsProvider.

Since fragment extends DialogFragment, it can be used as modal dialog as well.

UI customization

Fragment provides default UI, and it can be fully customized. By default content is represented by ListView, and it can be changed to GridView using setGridStyle(int) method. Next methods also can be overridden:
  • onCreateHeaderView(android.view.LayoutInflater) creates view, which is shown above the content and always visible.
  • onCreateFooterView(android.view.LayoutInflater) creates view, which is shown below the content and always visible.
  • onCreateUpButtonView(android.view.LayoutInflater) creates 'up' navigation button.
  • onCreateEmptyView(android.view.LayoutInflater) creates view, which will be shown if there's no content on current level. By default empty TextView is created, and it's value can be set using setEmptyText(java.lang.String).
  • onCreateItemViewBinder() returns instance of ItemViewBinder interface, which defines how View will be create from ScItem.

Listening to events

Next methods can be used for listening various events:
  • onScItemClick(ScItem)
  • onScItemLongClick(ScItem)
  • setContentTreePositionListener(net.sitecore.android.sdk.widget.ItemsBrowserFragment.ContentTreePositionListener)
  • setNetworkEventsListener(net.sitecore.android.sdk.widget.ItemsBrowserFragment.NetworkEventsListener)

onCreateUpButtonView

protected android.view.View onCreateUpButtonView(android.view.LayoutInflater inflater)
Creates view, intended for Up navigation through items tree. This view will be added above items browser list. After creation View.OnClickListener will be set to created view, which triggers navigation up.

Parameters:
inflater - LayoutInflater object that can be used to inflate any views.
Returns:
View, intended for Up navigation through items tree.
